creditline: Lent by The Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art, Kansas City, Missouri, Gift of Sadajiro Yamanaka
description: oval body with rounded foot and shoulder, flat area between shoulder and neck; raised flared rim; dark brown ground glaze overall with a yellow and blue-green V-shaped decoration at shoulder into body starting at opposite sides of mouth
medium:
Possibly Agano ware
Stoneware with iron glaze
text: The bulbous bodies of tea caddies such as this one are called <I>nasu<I> by the Japanese, meaning "eggplant." It is closely based on Chinese prototypes and was formed with extreme care, evident in its refined neck and mouth.
title: Tea caddy (chaire)
